text: Iván Gonzalo Vásquez Quilodrán (born 13 August 1985) is a Chilean professional footballer who plays for Magallanes as a midfielder. ==Club career== Born in Lautaro, Cautín Province, Vásquez joined Club Deportivo Universidad Católica's youth system in 2000 at the age of 15. He made his Chilean Primera División debuts three years later, and was part of the squads that won the 2005 Clausura and finished in second position at the 2007 Apertura; in 2006, he was loaned to fellow league club Cobreloa. In 2009, Vásquez joined O'Higgins FC. He scored his first competitive goal for his new team on 21 November 2010, playing the full 90 minutes in a 1–1 away draw against Unión Española. Vásquez moved to Audax Italiano on a three-year contract on 10 July 2011, going on to be a midfield mainstay in the following seasons. ==International career== Vásquez represented Chile at the 2005 FIFA World Youth Championship in the Netherlands, playing all the games in an eventual round-of-16 exit. ==Honours== ===Club=== ;Universidad Católica * Primera División de Chile: 2005 Clausura ==References== ==External links== * Audax official profile * Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Chilean people of Mapuche descent Category:People from Lautaro Category:Chilean footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Chilean Primera División players Category:Club Deportivo Universidad Católica footballers Category:Cobreloa footballers Category:O'Higgins F.C. footballers Category:Audax Italiano footballers Category:Chile under-20 international footballers
title: Iván Vásquez
